intro: Sisymbrium capillaceum, commonly known as slender broomrape, is a parasitic flowering plant that lacks chlorophyll and relies on host plants for nutrients. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has a fibrous root system that attaches to the roots of its host. It is often found in disturbed soils and can be a common weed in agricultural areas. Its life cycle is closely tied to the growth and health of its host plants.
